title: NASA cubesat bumped from rideshare launch because of orbital debris mitigation concerns
summary: A NASA cubesat was removed from a recent rideshare launch opportunity on a U.S. Space Force mission because the spacecraft could not meet guidelines for deorbiting at the end of its life.

title: NASA Seeks Student Experiments to Soar in Second TechRise Challenge
summary: NASA is calling on middle and high school students to join the second NASA TechRise Student Challenge, which invites student teams to develop, build, and launch science and technology experiments on high-altitude balloons.

title: Maxar’s satellite business looks to gain foothold in defense market
summary: To offset a downturn in commercial satellite sales, Maxar is positioning itself to compete in the national security arena, Chris Johnson, head of Maxar’s satellite manufacturing operations, tells SpaceNews in an exclusive interview.

title: Expedition 67 in final stretch as European Robotic Arm commissioning continues
summary: July saw Expedition 67 aboard the International Space Station reach two-thirds distance, with two months remaining until its longest-serving crewmembers return home and the rest of the crew transitions to the next increment. Over the course of the month, the crew has been continuing scientific research and housekeeping tasks around the station, while also receiving supplies from a Cargo Dragon freighter and performing a spacewalk on the Russian segment of the outpost.

title: First cubesat completed for NASA space science constellation
summary: The Space Dynamics Laboratory has completed the first of a constellation of cubesats for NASA that will act as a giant radio telescope in space to study space weather.

title: Student payloads to fly on RocketStar suborbital test flight
summary: TriSept Corp. has integrated two experimental payloads built by university students on a RocketStar suborbital test flight scheduled to launch next month.

title: NanoAvionics expands into heavier smallsat market
summary: NanoAvionics said Aug. 10 it has extended its range of modular satellite buses in another step toward the heavier end of the small satellite market.

title: SpaceX breathes fire in South Texas for the first time in 2022
summary: Two test firings on Tuesday bring the company closer to a Starship orbital flight.

title: Capella unveils a new generation of radar satellites
summary: Capella Space intends to offer improved image resolution and quality with a new generation of synthetic aperture radar satellites, called Acadia, scheduled to launch in early 2023.

title: Blue Canyon Technologies to build Tomorrow.io microwave satellites
summary: Blue Canyon Technologies won its largest constellation order to date, a contract with weather technology company Tomorrow.io.
